comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Salmon Cannery at Astoria – Then & Now (100 years later) Resting on the 100 year-old pilings that formerly supported the Union Fisherman's Cooperative Packing Company is the forty-six unit Cannery Pier Hotel – extending 600 feet into the Columbia River. Built in 1897, the Union Fisherman's Cooperative Packing Company processed and canned salmon, tuna, and various other Northwest fish, and became the salmon canning capital of the world. It remained a fishermen-owned business until the late 1940's, and much of the architecture of the original cannery building has been retained. [1] "The Cannery Pier Hotel" (2008)    by Bartolino "Salmon cannery" (1908)      by OSU Archives
